snippet: Economists were cautious but encouraged by reports showing that factories produced more goods in July. Home builders grew more confident and consumer prices stayed flat.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports industrial production rose 0.6 percent in July, the fourth consecutive monthly increase; National Association of Home Builders/Wells Fargo index finds home builder confidence rose to a five-year high of 37 in August from 35 in July; Labor Dept reports the Consumer Price Index was unchanged in July from June.
lead_paragraph: Economists were cautious but encouraged by reports showing that factories produced more goods in July. Home builders grew more confident and consumer prices stayed flat.

headline.seo: Factory Output and Home Builder Confidence Rise
headline.main: Factory Output and Home Builder Confidence Rise
headline.print_headline: Factory Output and Home Builder Confidence Rise
